message.content:
<<<api>>>: Scanner.nextLine()
<<<code>>>: Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
String[][] buyer = new String[10][15];
int row;
int column;

System.out.print("Specify which area you want to buy: ");
String input = scan.nextLine();
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "-");
row = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
column = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());

String name;
System.out.print("Name of the buyer: ");
name = scan.nextLine();
buyer[row][column] = name;
scan.close();
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we use the Scanner class to read user input. We first prompt the user to specify the area they want to buy, and then read the input using the nextLine() method. We then use the StringTokenizer class to split the input string using the hyphen as the delimiter. We parse the tokens as integers and assign them to the row and column variables.

Next, we prompt the user to enter the name of the buyer and read the input using the nextLine() method. Finally, we assign the buyer's name to the corresponding element in the buyer array.

Note that we close the Scanner object at the end to release any system resources associated with it.
